root_causes: Entry condition 'isTest()' from expected logic is not enforced in the script (no gating to run only in test mode).
The script uses SELECT IF without a preceding TEMPORARY, which would permanently subset the dataset (contradicts the stated intent to only temporarily list cases).
OE (open-text) error checks are logically incorrect: they use (STRIP(...) <> '' AND LENGTH(STRIP(...)) < 1) which can never be true, so OE problems will not be detected.
Helper-variable cleanup is described but actual DELETE/DELETE VARIABLES commands are missing â€” helper vars would remain in the dataset.

Range checks enforce non-negativity (value < 0 flagged) even though the expected logic does not specify an explicit numeric lower bound; this is an assumption not present in the spec and may be incorrect.
instructions: Enforce the entry condition isTest(): include an explicit test-mode gate before producing the listing or computing flags. Example approaches: (a) add TEMPORARY. SELECT IF isTest() AND HidA1ARPIS_dochecks = 1 AND HidA1ARPIS_flag = 1; or (b) COMPUTE _is_test = isTest(). and include _is_test = 1 in the SELECT IF condition. Ensure isTest() is evaluated per your environment.
Make the SELECT IF temporary so the dataset is not permanently filtered: add the command TEMPORARY immediately before the SELECT IF statement (e.g., TEMPORARY. SELECT IF ...).

Fix the OE error logic: flag an OE error when the stripped OE text is empty (i.e., user submitted nothing or only whitespace). Replace each OE check with something like: COMPUTE HidA1ARPIS_oeerr1 = (HidA1ARPIS_dochecks = 1 AND STRIP(HidA1ARPIS_1_other) = ''). Apply for all OE fields. (If you want to also flag extremely short responses, use LENGTH(STRIP(...)) < n with n>0 accordingly.)
Remove or correct the current impossible OE condition (STRIP(...) <> '' AND LENGTH(STRIP(...)) < 1) because it's always false.

Actually delete helper variables at the end of the script. Add a DELETE VARIABLES (or DROP) command listing all temporary helper fields created (e.g., HidA1ARPIS_dochecks HidA1ARPIS_sum HidA1ARPIS_prc1 ... HidA1ARPIS_itemflag5 HidA1ARPIS_flag).

Confirm numeric range expectations: either (A) if the intended lower bound is 0, keep the non-negativity checks but document this assumption, or (B) if no lower bound was intended in the spec, remove the HidA1ARPIS_rng# checks so you do not enforce an assumed bound. Update HidA1ARPIS_rng# computations accordingly.
Verify the assumed OE variable names (HidA1ARPIS_1_other ... HidA1ARPIS_5_other) match the actual dataset variable names; if not, replace them with the correct OE variable names.

Optionally: ensure the precision check and tolerance logic suits your SPSS environment. The current approach flags when ABS(value*10000 - ROUND(value*10000)) > tol; keep this but verify the RND/Round function name and tolerance are appropriate for your dataset.
